p: Bruton’s tyrosine kinase is a non-receptor tyrosine kinase involved in the activation of signalling pathways responsible for cell maturation and viability. The incubation of DLD-1 and HT-29 cells with MM-129 for 24 h resulted in downregulation of phosphorylated BTK (pBTK) expression compared with control as well as compared with RSC and 5-FU in both cell lines. The strongest reduction in BTK level was exhibited by the MM-129 at a concentration of 3 µM ( Figure 5(a–c)). These results were confirmed by confocal microscopy, where we also observed a significant decrease in BTK expression after MM-129 stimulation ( Figure 5(d)).
